pub_created_display: John II Komnenos (1118 to 1143), hyperpyron, Constantinople
notes_display: Clipped; concave; double strike on both sides; small hole on bottom right of Christ's nimbus. This coin does not fit any of the known coins in the catalogues checked - John has a labarum (r.), and has 7 jewels in his necklace.Possibly from Thessaloniki.
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: Christ (nimbate, w/ pellets) seated on a throne; right hand raised in benefaction, left hand holding the Gospels (5 pellets)
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: full length virgin crowns emperor holding a labarum (r.; two pellets on the shaft) and a globe (l.)
issue_reverse_figure_relationship_s: virgin on the right; emperor on the left
issue_reverse_legend_s: IW \ ΔE[C] \ Π[O] \ T[H]   *** ΘV   MP
